ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: NGO is working since 12 years, on SGSY project, Near about 550 plus Self Help Groups of tribal womenâ€™s from weaker section established of Below poverty line and linked to them with bank. Livelihood related Activities such Sales of Fertilizers, Goat rearing, Dairy have established. Some of SHG produces/sales 2000 plus liters milk per day getting well business for their economic upliftment. Vocational Training Programs on Tailoring, Paperdish Making, Garment Making, Beauty Parlour Training Program, Chalk Making Training, etc. are conducted with the gran-in-aid of Tribal Department and Sports Department. Near about 500 and more trainees are traineden above programs. We have also conducted Kishori Vikas Training for the Adolcent Girls. We have Organized Financial Literacy Camps in remote and Tribal area with the help of MARDEF TRUST (BANK OF MAHARASHTRA) to aware for economic and bank related activities. We are also working with NABARD Bank and have establish Famers clubs, to develop agriculture and creditability of farmers to availed new technique in the farm sector. Among these farmers club members have establish Producers Company â€“ Keshar Agricultural Producer Company,Borgaon Tal.Surgana,Di.Nashik ( All members are tribal and marginal farmers) for contract Farming, to provide Agriculture related Services, Trainings regarding crop, Agriculture Produce, Grading, Marketing and Finance Services. We are also working in Integrated Watershed Management Program as a Project Training Organisation in Igatpuri Block of Nashik District in Cluster No.33 of Batch V. In this project 5 villages adopted by Agriculture Department , Government of Maharashtra for to develop watershed project. Our NGO promoting to the community to participate in this project.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1) To run Anganwadi, Balwadi, Pre-primary, Primary, Secondary & Higher Secondary School in Marathi, Hindi & English medium for boys & girls, 2) To run Arts, Commers, Science, Medical, Engineering, D.M.L.T., Technical, Vocational, D.Ed., B.Ed., D.Pharm, B.Pharm, Physical Education, Agriculture Colleges for higher education, 3) To run schools for blind, deaf & dumb and Adult Education classes 4) To run hostels, Ashram Schools, Residential Schools, Mahilaashram, Cultural Centers. 5) To run employment information centers, vocational guidance centers for youth & women 6) To run Vocational training Institute like tailoring, embrodary for women. 7) To empliment various welfare development schemes of the Directorate of Women & Child Development of the Central & State government. 8) To run Gymnasium in order to create interest of exercise among the youths & to provide them up-to-date gymnastic materials. 9) To protest against the injustice & opperession to women & to make them self sufficient. 10) To participate in various national schemes like tree plantation, tree conservation, blood donation, eye donation, to protest against dowery system etc. 11) To run Gymnasium for rural boys & girls, to organize various Government recognized sport competitions, to arrange camps & to implement various Government recognized welfare schemes for youths & young women. 12) To run family guidance centers, to implement family welfare programmes & to implement various anti-dowery & anti prohibition schemes. 13) To implement various welfare schemes for Tribal development & to implement various government recognized welfare schemes for development of depressed & backword class peoples. 14) To provide modern technology from time to time for the financial progress of the farmers & also to provide advance knowledge & technology to the farmersthrough various film shows, video shows, exhibitions, speeches, seminars & also to organize different agriculture training workshops. 15) To run Rural Hospital in rural areas, to implement the prohibition programmes, contagious diseas-preventing programmes, AIDS preventive programmes. 16) To organize various public programmes in order to preserve culture. 17) To implement various schemes of National Women Cell (All the schemes i.e. Main Loan Scheme, Nodal Agency, etc.) 18) To undertake work from the fund of Government machinery, Semi-Government machinery, private machinery & public representatives. 19) To implement prohibition programmes. 20) To implement waste land, forest land, fallow land development & watershade convervation programmes & to construct houses under Indira Awas Yojana & also to implement urban water supply schemes. 21) To implement D.P.A.P. & Non D.P.A.P. programmes. 22) To implement all the schemes under Central Government CAPART (NABARD) Schemes. 23) To implement various schemes of rural development Mantralaya, Urban Development Mantralaya, Cultural & Tourism Development Mantralaya, Social Justice Mantralaya, Human Resource Development Mantralaya, Labour Development Mantralaya, Water Conservation & Development Mantralaya (Irrigation Development Mantralaya), Tribal Development Mantralaya & Health & Family Welfare Mantralaya of Central & State Government. 24) To start herbal, forest farming, botanical, allopathy, ayurvedic, homiopathyc, naturopathy courses & make research thereon & to provide essential facilities for medical treatement & operation for AIDS, Cancer, Heart diseases & other dangerous diseases & also general & minor diseases. 25) To undertake Gorakshan. 26) To run Agriculture School & College, Dairy Development & Management School & College, Agriculture Science Centre & implement all the agriculture schemes. 27) To make public awareness about Government & Semi Government schemes & to reach their benefits to the people & also to work as the representative Child Health Schemes, Catchment Area Development Programmes, Follow Land Development Programmes, Mother Non Government organization & all other work relating to aims & objects. 28) To implement jointly or individually the voluntary programmes of any voluntary organizations, co-operative Societies, Government co-operations, Semi financial institutions, foreign institutes, e.g. UNO, World Bank, NABARD etc. or any voluntary programmes of similar nature at State, National & International level. Similarly to receive all the concessions regarding national & International grants & donations under sections 80G, 35 Aof Income Tax Act & under any other Act & to work according to the aims & objects & also to obtain donations, grants & loans under Goreign Contribution Regulation Act & Under other Foreign Acts & to work according to the aims & objects.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Vision: For all women to feel confident and empowered to make their own choices and to be celebrated as equal and valuable members of their families & communities. Mission: To empower women with the knowledge, skills, courage, access and capital to become successful entrepreneurs with more control over their lives. OBjective: To reach one million women entrepreneurs by next 5 years. Mann Deshi Foundation transforms rural women from daily wage earners into role model entrepreneurs through economic empowerment. Mann Deshi Ventures (MDV) offers a range of customized business & skill training combined with financial services in order to help develop womenâ€™s technical and business skill set, knowledge of property rights, and leadership abilities enabling them to start their own ventures and empowering themselves and their families. These programs include a mobile MBA school that offers management and entrepreneurship training, and a chamber of commerce that offers new social networks as well as market and policy linkages for the women entrepreneurs. Additionally, during an extended drought period, the organization built bandhara i.e.checkdams to hold water and save farm animals. The radio station founded by Mann Deshi also provides news and critical business and agriculture tips to the surrounding area. Other Mann Deshiâ€™s Flagships: â€¢ Community Radio initiative builds local capacity and empowers women to improve their lives and those of their families through creative programming â€¢ Financial Literacy is a core course offered through Mann Deshi Udyogini (B-school for rural women), which imparts training on loan repayment and the importance of savings â€¢ Freedom Ride: To keep girls in school, Mann Deshi provides bicycles to rural girls through interest-free loans, making it possible for them to attend school â€¢ Umbrella Program distributes umbrellas through interest-free loans to street vendors to protect against sun exposure â€¢ Womenâ€™s Property Rights projects have been administered by Mann Deshi Foundation through a combination of government lobbying and activism â€¢ Mann Deshi Champions provides sport training to poor children, providing the opportunity to broaden their skills both physically and socially. Impact to Date: â€¢ Established in 1996, 8 business schools, 7 bank branches and 6 mobile business schools â€¢ Reached over 350,000 clients â€¢ Till date, over 190,000 rural women graduates

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Agriculture as a backbone of the country economy.Model Action For Rural Change has set up Model Action For Rural Change (MARCH) in 1997, Which is an independent non profit NGO working in collaboration with local as well as national development agencies. The main objective of the MARCH is to reach to all components of the society for the management of human and natural resources for sustainable development. Ultimate mission of the MARCH is to make people productive and prosperous where they are and to improve the quality of life in surrounding community through multifarious support activities like professional, technical and financial as well as catalyst for appropriate planning, implementation and post implementation care with the help of their own dedicated staff and volunteers. This is only possible with the help of involvement of the community concerned through motivation and coordination by MARCH along with various supporting agencies. The action plans of the organization give due weight age and importance to the traditional wisdom of the community and site specific needs. The main connecting link between commitment and performance as well as expectations and achievements.For the initiation of any activity, willingness and full involvement of community concerned is very essential for the fruitful results in long run. First of all MARCH identifies key trust areas and opportunities through involvement of all components of the society of activity sites. With this basic ground work, the concept is discussed with the community and professionals for proper pre-implementation planning.At Solapur,Pune,Nashik,Osmanabad and Kolhapur the emphasis has been mainly on provision of drinking water. MARCH is working in various areas of development for the last decade and has achieved positive results in all the development programme simple mented so far. For effective implementations, better management and the programme evaluation of the ongoing projects, categorized various sectors like water resource development, agriculture, animal husbandry environment conservation, watershed development, non-conventional energy sources, children and women development, health and education services, and relief operations during natural disasters. This way MARCH is committed for improvement of quality of life through integrated community development efforts. MARCH activities first began in Solapur in 1997. In the other units some activities have also been initiated in the last few years. However, owing to them being in existence for the longest duration and with a specially created team for such work, the Solapur unit is doing a variety activity. The work in Solapur has also become visible, and recognized by the local people and the government authorities. Work at Solapur thus has been detailed in this report and forms a major part of it.
